question: What is the purpose of battle

options.text: Ta see who’s da biggest an’ da stompiest!
To protect the Imperium, purge the heretic, and uphold the Emperor’s will with courage and discipline.
To strike with precision and guide fate to our advantage.
To instill fear, corrupt the weak, and seize power through any means.
To serve the Emperor and defend humanity, no matter the cost.

question: You’re betrayed by a fellow comrade. How do you respond?

options.text: Krump da git’s skull wiv me bare hands!
Escort them to command and follow orders
Sabotage their plans and dispose of them quickly.
Capture and torture them for information before execution
Inform the Commissar - he will surely execute them

question: Which unit do you aspire to be a part of?

options.text: I’d be one o’ da Meganobz — big, stompy, an’ proppa killy!
To serve among the Adeptus Astartes First Company Terminators, the Emperor’s finest.
To walk the path of the Striking Scorpions, silent hunters in the shadows.
To join the Raptors of Chaos, sowing terror before the slaughter.
To stand with the Cadian Shock Troops, unyielding against any foe.

question: You’ve been offered unlimited power, but at the cost of your identity. Do you take it?

options.text: If it makes me proppa choppyr, den yeah!
No. Honour and identity are sacred.
There must be another way.
Yes. I can remake myself into a God.
Tempting, but I must remain loyal to the Emperor.

question: You’re losing a battle. What do you do?

options.text: Charge ‘arder! Go out in a proppa WAAAGH!
Rally the troops and hold the line. We shall not falter.
Disengage and strike from the shadows later.
Flee and sacrifice the remaining servants and cultists to cover you.
We die standing

question: Your superior gives you an order you disagree with. How do you proceed?

options.text: Smash da boss in a proppa scrap!
If it does not dishonor the Chapter it shall be done
Follow the order, but modify it to suit your strategy.
Obey for now. Sabotage them later.
Sir Yessir!

question: You discover a dangerous relic. What do you do with it?

options.text: Use da shiny bitz straight away in a scrap!
Seal it away until approved by the High Council.
Study its properties and replicate its power.
Use it to manipulate your rivals.
Blimey, what does the Commissar think of this?

question: You are offered command of a battalion. What’s your leadership style?

options.text: Shout loud, stomp ‘ard, an’ bash from da front!
Command with honour, discipline, and the Codex Astartes.
Precise, calculated, and guided by foresight.
Rule through fear and sacrifice. Command chaos.
They may not like me, but they will follow me.

question: What is your view on weakness?

options.text: Weak gitz is fer stompin’!
It is a flaw to be corrected or purged.
A predecessor to suffering.
A mere tool. Exploit it to your advantage.
Weakness gets you killed out here, by them or by the Commissar

question: How do you react to betrayal from your commander?

options.text: Krump da boss an’ nick ‘is hat! If youz iz big enuf
Expose them and restore honour through justice.
Manipulate the situation to your advantage.
Commend their ambition. Then eliminate them yourself.
The Chain of Command must know. The Guard does not forgive betrayal.

question: What is your philosophy on war?

options.text: Orkz is made fer fightin’ an’ winnin’!
War is a sacred duty in service of the Emperor.
War is a tragic necessity — strike only when needed.
The Chaos Gods demand it!
War is survival. We fight, we die, and another regiment takes our place

question: You capture a dangerous enemy soldier who has killed many of your comrades. What do you do?

options.text: Rip off ‘is arms an’ wave ‘em like banners!
Detain them for interrogation, then execution.
Extract what you need and erase them without trace.
Corrupt their mind and recruit them to our cause.
March them before the Commissar. The Emperor’s justice will be done.

question: You arrive on the battlefield and face a larger enemy force. What’s your approach?

options.text: Charge in shoutin’ WAAAGH! Da bloodier da betta!
Establish a frontline, coordinate squads, and execute a flanking manoeuvre with precision.
Strike fast, disappear faster — distract and destroy before they know what hit them.
Send in waves of expendable cultists to weaken their morale, then descend upon them in full fury.
Hold the line. We are the wall, and the wall does not break.

question: You are the last survivor of your squad, surrounded with no way out. What do you do?

options.text: WAAAGH! I’z not goin’ quiet — if I go, I’m takin’ da lot wiv me!
We shall know no fear. For the Emperor!
Even in death, I serve the will of the Craftworld.
Blood for the Blood God! My death is just the beginning.
The Guard never yields, ten thousand men will take my place.

question: Which of these quotes resonates most with you?

options.text: Red wunz go fasta!
It is better to die for the Emperor than to live for yourself.
Even the stars fear our patience.
Sanity is for the weak.
We die standing.

question: Your base has been infected by tyrannid swarms. You still have some of your troops inside but the situation appears hopeless. How do you proceed?

options.text: Go an'shoot 'em up wit da boyz!
Orbital bombardment - followed by a ground assault. The horde must be purged
We withdraw and strike from afar.
Burn the entire place to the ground. No one can escape the wrath of Chaos.
Every man for himself. The regiment will survive.

question: A wounded ally begs you not to leave them behind. What do you do?

options.text: If dey can’t walk, dey’z just dead weight.
If I can save them, I will. But the mission comes first.
One death now may save many later. I move on.
They beg? Good. I feed on their despair.
If I can’t carry them, I grant them mercy and keep fighting.

question: Your forces are demoralised. What’s your rallying cry?

options.text: WAAAGH!! Gitz! Get back in da scrap!
We are the Emperor’s wrath! We shall know no fear!
The skein of fate favours us today.
Blood for the Blood God! Skulls for the Skull Throne!
Stand your ground! The Emperor will judge cowards, but I will shoot them first!

question: You’ve been captured by the enemy. How do you respond?

options.text: I’z gettin’ outta ‘ere, one way or anudder!
I will never betray the Emperor. I await rescue or death.
I will bide my time and strike when the moment is right.
I will corrupt my captors and turn them against each other.
Duty only ends in death.

question: Who is your most mortal enemy?

options.text: Da biggest, meanest gitz I can find...humies, spikey boyz, all of ‘em! I’z fightin’ anyone wot gives me a scrap!
The heretic and the alien must be destroyed.
The clumsy mon-keigh, whose ignorance tears the galaxy apart.
The False Emperor and his lapdogs skulls belong to the Dark Gods.
The xenos and the traitor. We may be only men, but we’ll never yield to them.

question: How do you feel about the Space Marines?

options.text: Blind zealots clinging to a dead god.
Noble warriors and the finest of mankind.
They are inflexible, predictable — easily outmanoeuvred.
Big ladz, but dey take fings' too serious.
Angels of the Imperium. I hope to die beside one.

question: How do you feel about the Chaos Marines?

options.text: Traitorous filth. They deserve only death.
They’ve embraced truth. Power matters more than loyalty.
Their chaos weakens the galaxy. They are reckless children.
Dey’s loud an’ smashy. I like dat!
I fear them. But I fight anyway.

question: How do you feel about the Orks?

options.text: The Green Tide is a formmiddable scourge upon the galaxy.
Their unsettling love for battle makes them the true winners of this war
We’z born fer fightin’ — nuff said!
Stupid beasts. Easy to corrupt or manipulate.
Their smell is the worst part

question: How do you feel about the Eldar?

options.text: Sneaky gitz hidin’ behind shiny trickz.
An untrustworthy ally, and an tricky foe.
Ancient, wise, and burdened with knowledge.
Even the Dark Gods envy their power.
They saved a regiment once. We never saw them again.

question: How do you feel about the Imperial Guard?

options.text: Pathetic meat-shields with a life expectancy of minutes.
The backbone of the Imperium. Honour them.
Cannon fodder. Predictable, breakable.
Deyz soft as squig, an’ slow as grots, but dey keep comin’
We are not the finest soldiers of the Imperium, but we are the ones who endure
